alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 9:39PM MDT until July 12 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 939 PM MDT, heavy rain has ended over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain was detected in the area of Upper Bland Canyon and Upper Peralta Canyon between 7 pm and 8 pm. Flood waters are expected to reach drainage channels around Cochiti and Cochiti Pueblo around 10 pm. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Bland Canyon, Peralta Canyon, and Rio Chiquito. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cochiti Lake, Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
